title: Enari Tuala
text:
Enari Tuala (born 19 October 1998) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. 
He previously played for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>, and has represented the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a>.
Background.
Tuala was born in <a href="Cairns">Cairns</a>, <a href="Queensland%2C%20Australia">Queensland, Australia</a>, and is of <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> descent.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Edmonton%20Storm%20%28rugby%20league%29">Edmonton Storm</a>, before being signed by the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
After being signed by the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>, Tuala moved to <a href="Townsville">Townsville</a>, where he attended <a href="Kirwan%20State%20High%20School">Kirwan State High School</a> and played for the <a href="Townsville%20Stingers">Townsville Stingers</a>' <a href="Cyril%20Connell%20Cup">Cyril Connell</a> and <a href="Mal%20Meninga%20Cup">Mal Meninga Cup</a> sides. In 2014, Tuala represented the <a href="Queensland%20under-16%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland under-16</a> team. In 2015, Tuala scored a hat trick in the Stingers' Mal Meninga Cup Grand Final victory and was selected for the <a href="Queensland%20under-18%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland under-18</a> team. Later that year, he scored twice in Kirwan's <a href="GIO%20Schoolboy%20Cup">ARL Schoolboy Cup</a> final victory over <a href="Patrician%20Brothers%27%20College%2C%20Blacktown">Patrician Brothers' College, Blacktown</a>. In 2016, Tuala played for North Queensland's <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> side, scoring 12 tries in 15 games. He was again selected for the Queensland under-18 side but was later ruled out through injury.
2017.
In early 2017, Tuala trained during the pre-season with North Queensland's first grade squad. He played in their first NRL trial against the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>, scoring a try in the 11-10 win.
In May, Tuala played for the <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a> against the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a>, before re-signing with the North Queensland club on a two-year contract until the end of 2019. In round 24 of the <a href="2017%20NRL%20season">2017 NRL season</a>, he made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Cowboys against the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>.
2018.
In Round 13 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a> against <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a>, Tuala scored his first NRL try in North Queensland's 26-12 win at <a href="Brookvale%20Oval">Brookvale Oval</a>.
On October 6, Tuala made his senior representative debut for the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a>, coming off the bench and assisting a try in the side's 34–18 win over the <a href="PNG%20Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">PNG Prime Minister's XIII</a>. A week later, on 13 October, he scored a double in the <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a> 40–24 win over the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a>.
2019.
Tuala played just seven NRL games for North Queensland in 2019. He spent the majority of the season playing for the <a href="Northern%20Pride%20RLFC">Northern Pride</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>.
On 13 September, it was announced that he would not be re-signed by the North Queensland club.
2020.
Tuala joined the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> on a one-year contract ahead of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 season</a>.
Tuala played 20 games for Newcastle in the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a> and scored 11 tries. He played in Newcastle's first finals game since 2013 which was a 46-20 loss against <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> in the elimination final.
2021.
In round 20 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Tuala scored a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> for Newcastle in a 34-24 victory over Canberra.
In round 22, he scored two tries for Newcastle in a 16-14 victory over <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland</a>.
In week one of the 2021 Finals Series, Tuala scored a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> for Newcastle in their 20-28 loss against <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta</a> in the elimination final.
